p.01703376c4a81c0e9d91: Connect to a remote database, behind a web server.
p.01703376c4a81c0e9d92:
This data connector generates SQL queries to be executed on a SQL database (eg: PostgreSQL or SQL Server) which is behind an HTTP Proxy. It requires HTTP endpoints to be able to process, on a database, raw SQL queries sent by this data connector.

This data connector typical configuration is:

| Parameter | Default value | Description | |---|---|---| | host | `none` | Hostname of the http endpoint | | port | 443 | Port used to access the HTTP endpoint | | ssl | `true` if port = 443, `false` otherwise | Whether to use HTTPS or HTTP protocol | | path | /data | Prefix path to access the HTTP endpoint| | dialect | `none` | SQL Dialect used to generate SQL queries. Posible values are the one supported by Knex library | | schema | `none` | The schema used in generated SQL queries | | authHeaders | {} | An object containing the headers to add to HTTP requests to reach the endpoint. Typically used to authenticate the requester. |
Example of a configuration to reach a SQL Server (MSSQL database) behind the HTTP endpoint `https://database.olympe.io/data`, that uses an api-key sent in headers to authorise requests:
```JSON "data.": { "host": "database.olympe.io", "port": 443, "ssl": true, "path": "/data", "dialect": "mssql", "#authHeaders": { authenticate this backend (shared secret). "apiKey": "1234-abcd-5678" }, "schema": "public" } ```
